I’m so sorry, Charles.

As usual, Darwin’s father was not pleased with his progress.

You call these grades?

You think you have a chance

at becoming

a clergyman with

marks like this?

Darwin had serious arguments with his father about his bad grades.

Yes, Father,

but all I need to

do is make sure I

graduate.

What!

Moreover, after Darwin received word that Fanny had become engaged to another man, he made up his mind to pour all his energy into studying.

That’s it.

From now on,

I will do nothing

but study.

45
